text:
Hey Guys question for the dynamic page,
Is it possible to create a page and have the same base url slug but different hubdb table to be called?
so its like

Category page
/solutions/{dyanmic_path}

Product page
/solutions/{dynamic_path}
I don't think i understood your question.. But one page can be mapped to only one dynamic table..
When creating a module to be used on a page, is it possible to read values from a HubDB table to fill a choice field in the module vs. hand typing out the choice label/value pairs?
<@U2H3TT8F2> is this possible? I am not much familiar with modules

It is not currently possible to feed HubDB row data into the page editor field options. You can however use a HubDB field to select a HubDB table itself, and display the information in the page itself.
If the HubDB values do not change frequently you could export the HubDB data and copy it into the fields.json used for choice fields. To make things a little easier.
<@UG52C29EE> <@U22PJPGK0> So I went into HubDB today and noticed this... (High fives coming your way :raised_hands: :partyparrot:)

I have a HubDB Lookup table containing Training Locations (column_name="location_name"). I also have a HubDB Table with Training Courses where the Training Location Name (column_name="course_location") is the Foreign Key.   I now need to grab all courses where course_location = 'Denmark'.  Is this possible? I was feeling like it is looking for the actual ID rather than the name?
